column1: No-cost and accessible COVID-19 testing is vital in our efforts to #stopthespread. Here’s where you can find walk up and drive up testing without an appointment in Connecticut. https://t.co/fjrj0rmJ9s
As cases continue to rise we are in this together to get our communities through this pandemic. Remember:    ✔Wear a mask  ✔Wash your hands  ✔Social distance when possible  #StopTheSpread

Today’s news that Pfizer #COVID19 vaccine is 90% effective so far is spectacular progress. Kudos to the talented Groton team that is now part of medical history - proud to represent you. https://t.co/3nDxcalhg9

There’s a lot on everyone’s mind right now but more than ever we must do everything we can to prevent the spread of #COVID19.   Wear a mask social distance when possible and do your part to keep you your family and your neighbors safe. https://t.co/wYx1zIZT8T

This year we relied on our neighbors to volunteer and ensure that this election was conducted faithfully. To everyone in eastern CT who stepped up to help our communities meet the challenge during COVID19—thank you. https://t.co/IW2ugYXFlR

Australia’s success in crushing the virus is a hopeful lesson for the world. It takes a disciplined public health plan beat COVID. From the Friends of Australia Congressional Caucus: ‘G’day to our friends Down Under’ https://t.co/Z2Ydbh6JX2

All across eastern CT our region’s health care providers are stepping up to the plate to provide weekly no-cost COVID-19 testing.    This Saturday @GenHealthCT is offering free walk-up testing at two additional pop-up locations in Windham. For more info see the flyer below. https://t.co/JHrXB8UqTu

#ImpactAid is vital to many schools in eastern CT especially those that serve high concentrations of children from military families. My bill makes sure schools don’t lose out on this funding especially now during #COVID19. https://t.co/gWYaR9bX6p

Free accessible #COVID19 testing is a key tool for controlling the spread of the virus. This weekend @HartfordHealthC @UCFS1877 and local health centers are offering no-cost testing at four locations in Norwich & Griswold. For more info see the flyer below. https://t.co/kywcsKZuJG

Need to get tested for #COVID19? Griswold Norwich and Willimantic have a number of free walk-up and drive-up testing sites open today. For more information see the flyer below or visit https://t.co/2gZsn7TZ3K. https://t.co/D4TXp55LIC

Last week my bill to safeguard #ImpactAid for military schoolchildren amid the pandemic was passed unanimously in the House and make sure the disruption of normal school enrollment caused by COVID-19 does not affect the support these communities receive. https://t.co/nrRm4N6GEB

.@CHCConnecticut is offering free walk-up and drive-up #COVID19 testing across eastern Connecticut.   No appointment is necessary but pre-registration is encouraged. For more information or to register call 475-241-0740 or visit https://t.co/OH6jrlqOWp https://t.co/Ev2u1P6dhc
COVID-19 is a serious disease and I wish @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS a speedy and full recovery.

This bipartisan spending package ensures construction of the #ColumbiaClass program moves ahead on schedule extends school meal flexibility amid #COVID19 & avoids a shutdown when we can least afford it.   Now the Senate must vote without delay.  https://t.co/JVfaKPy09w

This is a grim milestone. We all have a part to play in keeping our communities safe and this should spur the Senate to follow the House’s lead and pass a COVID relief bill to get our medical professionals towns families seniors and so many others the support they need. https://t.co/ukwlmUSvXb

Eastern CT has shown a lot of grit and smarts in fighting back against #COVID19 and this this new round of federal funding will help us continue to keep our communities safe so that we can stay on the path towards overcoming this pandemic. https://t.co/Mg6JVkcQCg

Great news this week as we welcomed home 2 new federal grant awards worth over $900000 to #NewLondon & #Norwich. Our region has shown a lot of toughness in fighting COVID19 and these funds will help keep us on the path towards overcoming the pandemic. https://t.co/xAD1vwbw4y

Thank you to Rear Admiral Kelly for hosting me back at @USCGAcademy yesterday for a catch up on a number of key initiatives underway on campus including their new “in house” COVID-19 testing lab. Semper Paratus! https://t.co/9RW3eIelcx

In the era of COVID-19 when every family has been expected to adapt in an ever-changing environment limiting access to school meal assistance is both cruel and short-sighted. Glad to see a reversal in this decision by @USDA. https://t.co/kQObK2O06R

Called in to @WINYRadio to thank Dave Ward for his service to CT as he prepares to sign off at week's end. Dave’s one of the best in the business and it’s been great to work with him. We caught up today to talk the latest on the next #COVID19 aid bill listen here: https://t.co/W35vu5OeRm

Last week I teamed up with @RepDustyJohnson to introduce the #bipartisan Impact Aid Coronavirus Relief Act a new bill to make it easier for school districts like Groton Ledyard and others to access funding through the Impact Aid Program during #COVID19 https://t.co/4WgCYLgZbT

Earlier this month I caught up with Robin Christy and Liz from @alzassociation CT Chapter last week to discuss the very real challenges still facing our seniors and caregivers as we continue the work to contain #COVID19 and the continued need for a proper federal response. https://t.co/8HuHWpJ6Lx

Today marks 100 days since the House the #HEROESact and 100 days without even a vote on a new #COVID19 relief bill in the Senate. It’s time to stop the clock on Senate inaction and pass comprehensive relief package–now. The House stands ready. https://t.co/2Viqcg9Js5

Great to join the @CTHealthCenters this week to catch up on some of the important work they’re doing in our region even amid revenue shortfalls brought on by #Covid_19. They need more support and the #HEROESAct would get it to them. https://t.co/hQ6IVb9UCq

Congrats to the #Mystic Fire Dept on their federal grant award to purchase essential #PPE supplies & more. Our #Firefighters are called to respond to so many emergencies & they’ve been a huge help throughout #COVID19. They need this support more than ever. https://t.co/wYfHHXekD2

Congratulations to the team @_seCTer on their $1.9 million grant award. We voted to authorize these funds with the CARES Act back in March & now they’ll help support eastern #CT businesses amid COVID19. More support is needed but this funding is welcome.https://t.co/3CxF5loxCx

1 in 3 low-income families have reported food insecurity in the last 30 days. The Senate’s refusal to expand nutrition assistance programs in their #COVID19 relief package of which thousands of American families depend on is reckless and cruel. https://t.co/cgoOOIMlvM

As negotiations for a fourth bipartisan #COVID19 relief package are underway your feedback is essential to ensure that eastern CT’s priorities are represented in the final agreement. To share your top concerns take my survey here: https://t.co/6isOLTRto3

CT continues to lead in efforts to contain the #COVID19 virus & keep transmission rates low. Thanks to our communities’ efforts to responsibly re-open our state we’ve been able to get our state’s economy back on its legs. Let’s keep up the good work. https://t.co/7DfxqobLgd

CT is one of the only states in the nation on track to containing #COVID19 and re-opening our state and economy. While Phase 3 of re-opening has been delayed for the meantime here’s some of what you need to know about the guidelines in place. https://t.co/IIhOXvcmDm

Thank you to @SenatorShaheen for helping to lead the charge in the Senate. All across the US Americans have the opportunity to refinance mortgages car loans & more. People should have the same opportunity to refinance their old #studentloans especially amid #COVID19. https://t.co/6hFhDuT8Qd

This week I hosted several of our local municipal leaders to talk about the revenue shortfalls our localities are facing amid #COVID19 & how the House-passed #HEROESAct would help families workers small bixz and many others. Watch more below from @NBCConnecticut. https://t.co/aZZnuAtPQB

During an @edlaborcmte hearing yesterday addressing the impact of #COVID19 on our public schools we heard from witnesses who confirmed that if support for localities doesn’t arrive soon schools will continue to experience significant layoffs hampering the reopening of schools. https://t.co/7hq6TiXZV6

I joined health care experts from @ctchildrens for a discussion about the role of #telemedicine in a #COVID19 era and our work at the federal level to ensure health care providers have the support they need to deliver patient care remotely. Watch here: https://t.co/Qoa507hs5J

CT cities & towns are projected to experience massive losses in revenue due to #COVID19 a reality that effects the paycheck of thousands of workers & critical services we rely on. Federal assistance is needed & Senate inaction could cost our communities. https://t.co/B6GgZsL0BJ

As is the case for all of our front line essential workers the men and women of our armed services like those onboard the USS Theodore Roosevelt continue to report to duty in high-risk environments on a daily basis in order to serve our country amid the COVID19 pandemic.

Great to stop by @AmericanWoolen in #StaffordSprings this week for a discussion with founder Jacob Long on mill operations during #COVID19 which has been maintained at an outstanding 90% the federal resources available to eastern CT businesses & projects underway at the mill. https://t.co/DrA7ALDJdK

In response to the ongoing economic fallout due to #COVID19 the Federal Housing Finance Agency has announced that @fanniemae and @FreddieMac will now allow some borrowers who went into #COVID19 forbearance to refinance their mortgage or buy a new home. https://t.co/96Uk1mTEXQ

As our economies begin to slowly reopen it’s important folks in eastern CT have accurate & up to date information on what to do if they think they have #COVID19 symptoms. For more information make sure to visit my resource page at https://t.co/QJjpMxBhc1 https://t.co/gY4RSXNLRg

This Tuesday I’m hosting a telephone town hall to discuss the ongoing federal response to#COVID19 and progress on the new federal relief package the #HEROESAct. To sign up or live-stream the event visit my website at https://t.co/Y3aEkQO0Hf. https://t.co/43iKx75YOq

A few moments ago the House passed a 4th bipartisan #COVID19 response & relief bill the #HeroesAct to send a new wave of resources out the door and into the toolboxes of American homes businesses & communities. Now the Senate must move quickly & hold a vote. https://t.co/9LNsr0kgJa

Tuesday 5/19 at 6:10 PM I’m hosting a telephone town hall to discuss the ongoing federal response to #COVID19 and progress on the new federal relief package the #HEROESAct that is being negotiated now. To sign up or live-stream the event visit https://t.co/Y3aEkQO0Hf https://t.co/2vC4eW7saU

The fallout of #COVID19 isn’t slowing down and resources need to keep pace. The #HEROESAct would provide critical new aid to families workers & #smallbusiness bolster testing efforts provide #hazardpay to essential employees and much more. https://t.co/Zvkk42HBhN

Welcome news for our region with last week’s announcement of two federal grants totaling more than $800000 to 2 eastern CT health centers to expand the range of COVID-19 testing and testing activities across our region. Read more here: https://t.co/z8u4hH0vaF
Negotiations are underway for a 4th bipartisan #COVID19 aid bill. I want to hear from you – what are your priorities for the upcoming relief package? Take my survey here: https://t.co/wCBeqttnuk

The process of crafting a new #COVID19 response package is underway and the feedback I receive from our region’s workers businesses farmers and families are the initiatives I’m bringing back to the negotiating table in Washington. https://t.co/nhkxuBRcVT

May 4th marks #InternationalFirefightersDay & a reminder to voice our appreciation & support for our nation’s first responders & firefighters. In the era of COVID its more important than ever to ensure they have the resources they need to stay safe while on the job. https://t.co/z36kxAOzNz

This week I joined  the @GilmanBrothers from #Bozrah on a call to discuss their progress and on a massive effort to produce critically needed medical supplies for FEMA amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/Wm9MbnLc7x

The aid for states @senatemajldr is rejecting is for nurses first responders & #COVID19 tests at the Dept. of Public Health that ours state needs to get out of this crisis. Wake up Mitch! We need these resources to save lives & re-open our economy. https://t.co/4bZceX7bCv

Historically CT’s public education system has taken significant blows to funding during times of economic hardship. We can’t let that history repeat itself – protecting our schools and educators must remain a top priority in our work ahead to address the fallout from #COVID19. https://t.co/VGDwml9tSi

This week @GovNedLamont & Bank Commissioner Jorge Perez announced new initiatives to provide relief for students with privately held student loans who are struggling to make payments due to #COVID19. For more information visit my resource page at https://t.co/QJjpMxBhc1. https://t.co/FPl5wl1jZF

The House voted to pass the interim #COVID19 emergency funding bill today by a vote of 355-8. The bill reopens #SmallBusinesses lending programs with more funding than was first proposed and it secures new resources for hospitals and testing. More on today's vote here: https://t.co/jKbXvrAaVo

Your #EconomicImpactPayment is not taxable income and it will not – WILL NOT – reduce or increase the amount you owe this year or when you file your 2020 tax return next year. For more visit my #COVID19 resource page: https://t.co/QJjpMxBhc1 https://t.co/5XCHoB0yxc

Audrey and I heading to DC to pass Emergency Funding bill for hospitals COVID testing and small businesses. Thank you to our nurses first responders and small businesses for all you do. #ThankYouEssentialWorkers https://t.co/C9fa00z0uH

Tomorrow at 6:30 PM I’m hosting a telephone town hall to discuss the ongoing federal response to #COVID19 and progress on a new supplemental relief package that is being negotiated now. To sign up or live-stream the event visit my website at https://t.co/Y3aEkQO0Hf https://t.co/HTPVTCYJNT

We can't afford a fragmented response to #COVID19 - small businesses hospitals and more are all in need of immediate support. This 4th aid package was renegotiated to be more effective & as soon as a #bipartisan deal is announced Congress needs to be ready to pass it.

Bipartisan negotiations are closing in on a renegotiated interim #COVID19 aid bill that provides an even bigger boost to #SmallBusiness & #PPP than @senatemajldr proposed as well as urgent funding for #Hospitals& #CovidTesting which he left out entirely.https://t.co/JwH9lhNp7D

Millions of Americans rely on our postal system for critical needs such as medicine #socialsecurity billing & more but as the #COVID19 pandemic continues to impact every sector of our economy @USPS has projected a $13B revenue loss directly from the crisis.

Joined representatives from the CT Farm Bureau last week for a discussion about federal relief to farms that have been impacted by #COVID19 and our work to push the administration to ensure family dairies & specialty crop growers in CT receive their fair share. https://t.co/eNBvdRTN8d

The bipartisan call for IMMEDIATE additional funds for state & local governments who are on the #COVID19 front lines foot stomps the reason why #MitchMcConnell should wake up and add this sort of help to the SBA emergency funding bill. https://t.co/ZfCrfKUbkE

In response to #COVID19 Congress has provided robust emergency funding to ensure the @DeptVetAffairs has the equipment tests and support services necessary to provide veterans with the additional care they need. More information at https://t.co/QJjpMxBhc1 https://t.co/o10gmimboD

Yesterday’s announcement of over $1.7 million in federal grant funding to eastern CT health centers will help ensure our health care professionals - the front line in the fight against #COVID19 - have the tools and & resources they need to save lives. https://t.co/IcGSoX4gON

As part of the response to the economic fallout from #COVID19 Congress authorized direct cash payments to qualifying individuals & families. It's important to note that these are federal tax rebates therefore NOT considered taxable income. More info at https://t.co/QJjpMxBhc1 https://t.co/u15at6NliS

If you or someone in your family is seeking unemployment due to the COVID-19 public health emergency visit https://t.co/G6LyWMH6fI and click the blue button to start your claim. For more information see my guidance below or visit https://t.co/XIb58fyfra https://t.co/X2p2B6CPCG

Spoke with @usnavy leaders yesterday re the Teddy Roosevelt #COVID outbreak. Rotating the crew off-ship is the right call to test them & to do deep cleaning. The Navy needs more than an adhoc response to stop the spread of this virus on our ships & subs. https://t.co/BqrO5NxqYa

On #NationalVietnamWarVeteransDay we reflect on the sacrifices made by our vietnam veterans during wartime and their continued service to our communities since. For information from the VA on the latest events & updates related to #COVID19 visit: https://t.co/WuZ7U4KFTY

As we continue to battle #COVID19 maintaining support for those who have served is critical. Much like our health care workers & first responders are doing so now on the home front our nation’s #VietnamVeterans placed their lives on the line to protect the American people.

The amazing staff at @ctchildrens have launched a #COVID19 hotline for CT families with children under 18 to ask their questions about the pandemic and consult with a health care professional directly. The hotline is open 24/7. To call dial 1-833-226-2362.

Notice just went out to House Members that a #Quorum might be necessary to keep working & pass the bipartisan #CARES Act for #CovidRelief. Heading over now — we’ve got to get this across the finish line.

Tomorrow the House is voting on the third bipartisan economic stabilization package in response to #COVID19. Audrey and I are packed up working the phones and driving down to DC for tonight’s telephone town hall ahead of tomorrow’s vote. Sign up at https://t.co/Y3aEkQO0Hf https://t.co/FID0xdsUbZ

If you are unemployed due to the #COVID19 public health emergency and are seeking benefits or an employer seeking additional information please visit https://t.co/UmHQ4FfRhb. Do not wait file your claim now. https://t.co/T5l6GXqWnh

Tomorrow night I’m hosting another telephone town hall event for the chance to update eastern Connecticut residents on the #COVID19 public health emergency and for the opportunity you to ask me your questions directly. Sign up here: https://t.co/Y3aEkQO0Hf https://t.co/LpcVs1dZm8

Social distancing is the best way to slow the spread of #COVID19 & help ensure that our hospitals can treat those who need it. By “flattening the curve” we’re allowing our health care system to cope saving thousands of lives. See @CDCgov’s tips at https://t.co/AeQ5EdC3x0 https://t.co/K7YoBiwFhV

The @usedgov announced that during the #COVID19 emergency federal #studentloan borrowers can suspend payments for at least 60 days with 0% interest. To do so you MUST contact your loan servicer. There’s more we can do but this is a good start. https://t.co/KLiTzXL33X

The CT Department of Education is authorizing two categories of COVID-19 Emergency Meal Programs. For the latest information on where kids 18 & younger can keep up with the school meal program even while school is closed visit https://t.co/rAvwwaxkmq https://t.co/ZldLw6WDRs

If you are a small business in CT seeking more information regarding closures of non-essential businesses further guidance will be issued today by the Governor’s office. Until then you can call the @CTDECD small business hotline at 860-500-2333 or email COVID19JIC@CT.gov.

The sooner Americans are protected against #COVID19 the better. Proud to introduce a bipartisan bill that ensures there’s no delay between a vaccine approval & the ability of Americans to receive it without cost-sharing. https://t.co/VXHWMeedjV

As workers businesses & families across the country continue to confront the #COVID19 public health emergency my office remains available to eastern CT residents as a resource for information & guidance. For helpful resources visit my website here: https://t.co/DSMdbP5Db8 https://t.co/22gFbLk5a9

The House’s #bipartisan bill that passed @ 1:00am yesterday to address #COVID19 was good work but really impressive to see folks in eastern #CT stepping up big time to stop the outbreak. Every single American deserves affordable access to the #Coronavirus vaccine once it becomes available. It’s flat out unacceptable that Secretary Azar refused to commit to ensuring that a vaccine for the #COVID19 outbreak would be affordable to all. https://t.co/A6fj2RpkIR
